title: Ant and Dec apologise after setting off Alexa devices during BGT final
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Ant and Dec have apologised after the two accidentally set viewers’ Amazon Alexa alarms off during the final of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions.

During the star-studded final, the two presenters were introducing Germany’s Got Talent contestant Alexa Lauenburger, whose dog act, which involved her commanding a series of dogs to form a conga line, helped her to secure a place in the show’s final – and nab the golden buzzer from Ant and Dec.

And they took the opportunity to make a reference to the virtual Amazon device as they welcomed her on stage to perform her act.

‘Alexa, can you show us how to win Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions?’ the two called out.

However, some fans have now revealed that the duo simply saying the word ‘Alexa’ actually caused their devices to go off.

‘How many people watching #BGT just had @andanddec set off their Alexa’s?’ one fan said on Twitter.

Another added: ‘@antanddec just set my Alexa off,’ adding a crying with laughter emoji to her comment.

‘When @antanddec shout #Alexa every Alexa in your homes are going crazy right now, mine included haha, thanks boys,’ another viewer wrote.

As a result, And and Dec subsequently took to their own Twitter account to issue an apology on behalf of the devices they set off.

‘Oooops! Did we all set your Alexa’s off again? Soz,’ they tweeted.

And of course, fans in the replies saw the funny side to the whole ordeal.

‘I missed the dogs performing coz was laughing so much at my Alexa,’ one fan replied.

‘She said, “Sorry, I can’t answer that question.”’

The show also saw the presenting duo launch a new mental health campaign, titled Britain Get Talking, as they encouraged the audience and everyone at home ‘to get together with people we care about and talk’.

And it was a star-studded final which saw British dancing duo Twist and Pulse crowned winners of the series, beating fellow dancers Stavros Flately and Ukrainian sand artist Ksenyia Simonova to the top.

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions is available to stream on ITV Hub.
